app_about:
Welcome back to the Cyber Team!

This is a small set of challenges just to whet your appetite and get your head back in the game. Please, don't consider it a competition -- you're not in it to win anything or race to the top. The challenges here are meant to be simple, but still have enough quirks to remind you 'how to cyber'... you know, think critically and research tools and techniques, and hopefully write some code.

Good luck and have fun!

challenges.title: Cats
challenges.prompt:
Not just a musical! Connect to the service running on 10.6.1.7, port 3887.

Don't know this means? Trying Googling what `cats` can be on the net!

challenges.title: IRS
challenges.prompt: The Internal Revenue Service has a new covert communication channel. Your money is always safe!

challenges.title: Pack'd
challenges.prompt: What secrets does this binary hold??!

challenges.title: The Bomb
challenges.prompt:
Oh no! A bomb is going to go off in this house, only you can stop it! http://10.6.1.7/the_bomb/

If only the bomber left something behind...

challenges.title: HashHash
challenges.prompt:
CashCash is rebranding their name and releasing new electronic music, all under the new stagename HashHash! Listen to their new song here!

NOTE: This is not in the usual flag format.

challenges.title: Polybius
challenges.prompt:
Polybius is hosting a party, and you're invited. He gave you his number; be there or be square!

NOTE: This is not in the usual flag format.

challenges.title: PDF-orensics
challenges.prompt: The latest files from our ongoing investigation are getting more and more obscure. Find out what they are hiding!

challenges.title: Base Contest
challenges.prompt: It's a whole new kind of competition -- who is the best base?

challenges.title: Tragic Number
challenges.prompt: For some reason this zip archive won't unzip. Help!

challenges.title: Winter Wonderland
challenges.prompt: It's the holiday season! But hmm... they must be hiding something under all that cheer!

challenges.title: shattered
challenges.prompt:
Remember Bsides? If only we knew about tcpflow...

Wrap the flag in the typical "USCGA{}" format.

challenges.title: Executive Order
challenges.prompt: The World-Wide-Warden just released a new executive order on some kind of weird technology trick, used in math and science. But it all looks like nonsense to me...

challenges.title: Hot Access
challenges.prompt:
Access to all the latest modules, hot off the press! What can you access?

http://10.6.1.7:5555/
